title: Envio Config Schema
description: Schema for a YAML config for an envio indexer

contracts.description: Global contract definitions that must contain all definitions except addresses. You can share a single handler/abi/event definitions for contracts across multiple chains.

networks.description: Configuration of the blockchain networks that the project is deployed on.

unordered_multichain_mode.description: A flag to indicate if the indexer should use a single queue for all chains or a queue per chain (default: false)

event_decoder.description: The event decoder to use for the indexer (default: hypersync-client)

rollback_on_reorg.description: A flag to indicate if the indexer should rollback to the last known valid block on a reorg (default: false)

save_full_history.description: A flag to indicate if the indexer should save the full history of events. This is useful for debugging but will increase the size of the database (default: false)

field_selection.description: An object representing additional fields to add to the event passed to handlers.

raw_events.description: If true, the indexer will store the raw event data in the database. This is useful for debugging, but will increase the size of the database and the amount of time it takes to process events (default: false)

name.description: A unique project-wide name for this contract (no spaces)

abi_file_path.description: Relative path (from config) to a json abi. If this is used then each configured event should simply be referenced by its name

handler.description: The relative path to a file where handlers are registered for the given contract

events.description: A list of events that should be indexed on this contract

event.description: The human readable signature of an event 'eg. Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 value)' OR a reference to the name of an event in a json ABI file defined in your contract config. A provided signature will take precedence over what is defined in the json ABI

rpc_config.description: RPC Config that will be used to subscribe to blockchain data on this network (TIP: This is optional and in most cases does not need to be specified if the network is supported with HyperSync. We recommend using HyperSync instead of RPC for 100x speed-up)

hypersync_config.description: Optional HyperSync Config for additional fine-tuning

confirmed_block_threshold.description: The number of blocks from the head that the indexer should account for in case of reorgs.

start_block.description: The block at which the indexer should start ingesting data

end_block.description: The block at which the indexer should terminate.

contracts.description: All the contracts that should be indexed on the given network

url.description: URL of the RPC endpoint. Can be a single URL or an array of URLs. If multiple URLs are provided, the first one will be used as the primary RPC endpoint and the rest will be used as fallbacks.

initial_block_interval.description: The starting interval in range of blocks per query

backoff_multiplicative.description: After an RPC error, how much to scale back the number of blocks requested at once

acceleration_additive.description: Without RPC errors or timeouts, how much to increase the number of blocks requested by for the next batch

interval_ceiling.description: Do not further increase the block interval past this limit

backoff_millis.description: After an error, how long to wait before retrying

fallback_stall_timeout.description: If a fallback RPC is provided, the amount of time in ms to wait before kicking off the next provider

query_timeout_millis.description: How long to wait before cancelling an RPC request

url.description: URL of the HyperSync endpoint (default: The most performant HyperSync endpoint for the network)

name.description: A unique project-wide name for this contract if events and handler are defined OR a reference to the name of contract defined globally at the top level

address.description: A single address or a list of addresses to be indexed. This can be left as null in the case where this contracts addresses will be registered dynamically.

abi_file_path.description: Relative path (from config) to a json abi. If this is used then each configured event should simply be referenced by its name

handler.description: The relative path to a file where handlers are registered for the given contract

events.description: A list of events that should be indexed on this contract

transaction_fields.description: Fields of a transaction to add to the event passed to handlers

block_fields.description: Fields of a block to add to the event passed to handlers
